answerText: Yevgeny Yevtushenko[10] "No monument stands over" the title place of this Yevtushenko poem, in which the author sees himself as Dreyfus and Anne Frank. This poem was set to music in 1962 by Shostakovich in his Symphony No. 13.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 5 | 19 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poet criticized the hypocrisy of his countrymen in his poem "Talk," while in another poem he claims that the title leader "still lurks in the mausoleum." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet who used the line "As we get older we get honester" to begin a poem about his hometown, "Zima Junction."
